page.title: 01ISYCOED AND SHOCKLACH
page.content: This is an area of farmland on the East and West banks of the river Dee. The ground is well suited to the cultivation of rich pasture for cattle, Friesian and cross Hereford/Freisian, either for milk production or beef. There is no river bridge. On both sides of the river is a metalled North-South road. Generally the Dee and the Worthanbury brook divides England from Wales. There is very little employment so one cn wander over the fields and see only a few people all day. Shocklach has a lovely Church and a small Chapel, and Isycoed has another pretty church, all well kept. Some farms have erected sheds for battery hens.
